summary:
Palladium (symbol Pd) is a rare, silvery-white metal discovered in 1802. It's part of the platinum group and has the lowest melting point among them. Palladium is mostly used to reduce harmful gases in car exhausts and in fuel cells. It's also used in electronics, medicine, and jewelry.

Found in few places, the main sources are in South Africa, the US, Canada, and Russia. Due to its many uses and rarity, palladium is a popular investment.
title: Palladium
